text: People might not agree with me, but I feel like Sakuraba lost his unique touch. When I compare his early Tales and Star Ocean soundtracks to what he's doing now, it's like he's just on automatic drive now pumping out tons of uninspired music. Maybe it's not that surprising with the amount of Tales games that came out. This theme is a perfect example of Sakuraba magic.
author: SupraDarky

text: As a huge Tales fan I can sorta get where you are coming at.  I do still feel he hits it dead on with some songs but as much as I love Graces f for it's fun battle mechanics, I can't remember much of the music.
author: LeonisBrafer

text: Haven't played the most recent Tales games yet, but I did notice a dip in quality for the OSTs as the series went on..
author: Waywarde

text: I've actually never been a huge fan of Sakuraba music...  They work great in the game, but they almost never capture my attention as standalone music pieces.  This one is better than most that I've heard, and perhaps this has to do with me starting with the later games?
author: terracannon876

text: @terracannon876 his music certianly fits and are catchy, but are hardly memorable.
author: Freddy Martinez

text: No i fully agree, its actually why i kind of wish he'd just step away from the franchise for a while, i think its a massive missed opportunity for the games to feel distinct by not allowing them to have different composers like say a FF game.
author: jsh020

text: I haven’t really liked anything he’s written since Golden Sun. He’s just phoning it in now.
author: jb1980ist

text: Hmm, he never really stood out for me except for his battle themes, and even considering that I can barely remember the last few pieces from him.
author: RoyalGreenTea

text:
I remember from an interview that Sakuraba did some years ago where he mentioned that he would have liked to do something different for the tales games but he was asked not to make the sound too thick or something to that effect and tries to stay within a specific tales theme. Tales of Graces and onward is when I personally started to notice uninspiring tracks.

I am almost certain that had it not been for this we would've seen more of his magic. And that outside of Tales we get to see him work relatively unfettered like in Dark Souls, for example.
author: virgil9940

text: I'm a HUGE fan of Sakuraba's early works, and I totally agree. The last game he helped compose for (period, not just Tales) that grabbed me was Vesperia. Even then, he'd been past his prime for a while.
author: Solvanderlyn

text:
Probably to a lesser degree, but, Sakuraba has always had this issue. Tales of Eternia's OST sounds like it was made entirely of unreleased Star Ocean 2 tracks.
Some of the Baten Kaitos tracks he composed however sounded like he was let off his leash which was obviously well after ToE.
author: RizziSmoov The 2nd

text: Indeed I don't agree with you, Sakuraba created a lot of memorable compositions after this game, it's not fair to diminish them.
author: Sunny Burrito

text: Completely agree. Besides Tales of Phantasia, Tales of Destiny, Star Ocean 2 (and to a lesser extent the original Star Ocean), I had a really hard time getting into any of his other work. There were some good tracks here and there, but most were filler imo, with a lot of monotonous droning.
author: onresonance

text: Go Shiina is the best thing to happen to the Tales series musically by far.
author: ramminchuck

text: I mainly think Sakuraba phones in the OSTs that he does for new Tales of games. The music he composes for other game series is generally better (if not exactly amazing).
author: Adam Epp

text:
@Freddy Martinez 
Hard disagree. I listen to Golden Sun, Tales of and Baten Kaitos tracks almost daily.
author: Gaming will NEVER be good again

text:
@Solvanderlyn 
Dark Souls and Golden Sun: Dark Dawn tho?
author: Gaming will NEVER be good again

text: @Gaming will NEVER be good again Tales of symphonia had a great one!!
author: Aaron Holley

text: That piano sounding exactly like Donkey Kong Country
author: Jiggy Wiggy ASMR

text: The game that started it all, and forever my favorite Tales of, too bad it is so much underrated :(
author: actinid14

text: Wonderful track!
author: Inexpugnabilis

text: Am I mistaken, or do I hear some of Flanoir in there from ToS?  If so, now I know where it got it from.
author: Honatuto

text:
Please upload more Ys soundtracks.
I know I can find them everywhere, it just feels more special when Supra uploads them 😉
author: Ahmed360

text: great classic game with a lovely soundtrack
author: Licinius Varrus

text: I didnt know this was on SNES I only had it on gba =0
author: Robin Glick

text: This game is so underrated. Going back and replaying on it SNES is always a treat when you come at it from a perspective of how revolutionary it was at its time. It's nearly a PSX experience on a SNES cartridge.
author: genesisSOC

text: Have you played the PSX remake? It improves on the original in almost every way.
author: onresonance

text: @onresonance I have, but I'm not a fan of the more chibi graphics and weak combo system. It also makes the game much easier. It's certainly not bad by any means, but I really prefer the SNES version.
author: genesisSOC

text: @genesisSOC Ah. Yea, guess the chibi graphics never bothered me. I did enjoy the extra dialogue cutscenes and the extra optional character. The original was still an amazing game though.
author: onresonance

text: What version did you play?
author: MJeyy

text: I have a little playlist with various snow themes; this one's been there since the day I made it.
author: Sephiko
